comments.commentBody:
Are we watching the same matches? He certainly did call on boy ball kids earlier in the tournament. You generalize when he says women should be paid less;he meant female tennis players because they play only two of three instead of three of five. I agree with him and I've heard that some of the female players want to play more......
Gracious, mais oui! Generous, certainement....and, he no longer beats his chest!
Murray is creepy.  Novak is brilliant.
i  get your point, but he can't play who isn't there whether thru choice, injury or being defeated in earlier rounds.

I don't understand why commenters don't get that he wasn't a grand slam winner today. he won an individual tournament which is one of the four majors.

he's won four grand slams in a row which is remarkable.

he now has a career grand slam. the last time that was done in men's tennis, to my recollection, was when Federer won the French open in 2009 to complete his quest.

however AND I REPEAT MYSELF, a true grand slam is when all four majors--in golf or tennis--are won in the same calendar year.

he might well win Wimbledon and the us open and will be able to claim the grand slam in 2016 as laver did in 1962 as an amateur and 1969 as a pro but not until then.

finally, when tiger woods won four consecutive majors it was called a tiger slam. one of the talking heads on the broadcast called it a joko slam or words to that effect....
You're simply wrong.

I grew up in "Louibulle"...knew Ali.... watched as history surrounded him..........There is no God except Allah the Generous and Patient There is no God except Allah the Almighty and All-Wise. Pure is that Allah Who is Creator of the seven heavens and the seven earths and all that is in them and between them; He is the Lord of all these things and the Arsh and all praise is due to Allah Who is the Lords of all the worlds.....O Who accepts even a little amount and forgives a amount of evil, accept my little good and forgive the  large amount of my evil. Undoubtedly Thou art the Great Forgiver and the Dispenser of Mercy.

Authentic, insistent, explosive, powerful, and historic:

“What's my name?”
-Muhammad Ali
...I was just a young middle class lad in Dublin when Ali came on the scene...I can't describe it but to me he really was the greatest....

Correction-addition: the Greatest. The Champ. HIM.

You were the beautiful floating butterfly.
Potent bee that you were, you surely stung.
You never pulled punches about bigotry.
A man of principle, when it came to Viet Nam,
you walked the walk, though it cost you.

Your humor, your playfulness, your intelligence, the twinkle and the fierce flash in those eyes, your confidence and that smile.

Miss you, Ali. Miss you.

6-5-16@11:59 pm

My approximately 20 home subdivision was built just outside the Atlanta City limits in 30342 in 1961-1965. The homes started at just over 2,000 sf ranch with 2 baths in 1961 then progressed to 2,800-3,300 two half bath two story homes by 1964-65. Most of the homes had gunite pools added in the mid to late 60's as they had kids.

Now as can even be seen on Bravo's Real Housewifes of Atlanta, neighboring houses outside my subdivision are being torn down to build 4,500-12,000 sf. McMansions with 10' Ceilings. ( The houses from the 50's to 80's only have 8' ceilings and 4/12 roof pitches. Which makes them smaller volumes.) Bravo's infamous Chateau Sheree is less than 1 mile south or mine. Surrounding it are other examples of the new larger rebuilds with million dollar price tags.

I and several of my neighbors in our little 20 home enclave have simply chosen to rework the original space or pop out Master bath additions. I took two small bedrooms and combined them for a Master Bedroom Suite. Then closed off the odd jack n Jill baths, so now the remaining two bedrooms each have their own. I am in process of converting the outdated formal living into a first floor bedroom and bath. I will still have a great room which I opened the kitchen to the first week. The grand piano room is a versatile office/den for us. The only limiting factor is the 8' ceilings.

I just have to fight to keep my tax appraisal down with the tax man.

In the scene where Arya is walking up on the bridge be fore being stabbed, there is a character on the left side of the screen walking away, face unseen, who appears to be dressed like and have the same hairstyle as Arya had when selling clams.  Coincidence?
IN similar vein, "Theon, the lactose intolerant guy at the fondue party", I just laughed uncontrollably
there is more to that scene, with Arya and the waif, than meet the eye.  Lot of clues that things were not as they seemed.

"She strolled around Braavos, taking in the sights, and what’s this? A kindly old woman wants to have a word?"
+
"Davos, the little girl whisperer"

You kill me. XD

Great episode.
No, Davos does not know about Shireen.  If he knew, he would have nothing to  do with the Red Woman

I think he knows she is dead, but now that they are camping where Stannis camped, as Davos noted, perhaps he will come across evidence of her burning? Thanks to the unburnable dragonscale part of her face?
Brilliant

Davos learned of Shireen's fate from Melissandre earlier in the season.  I think Littlefinger will help Sansa and John Snow but for a price...marriage to Sansa?  That would be her third marriage.  Is there a male term for sister wife?  Would Tyrian, Ramsay, and Littlefinger be brother husbands?

I don't think Cersei is redeemable. She's still that b-word IMO because she is heartless except when it comes to Lannisters, Tyrion being the exception. I don't think The Hound was ever a really bad character. He was pressed into fighting, actually, slaughtering people, early on due to his size, but he seemed to always try to do the right thing when he could. Anyway, I too am glad he's back.

I don't understand Arya's demeanor either. You would think that she would have learned by now that you can't take anything for granted. In fact, you would think all of the Starks -- halfbloods included -- would have learned that lesson by now. They constantly overestimate the fealty to the Stark name -- 62 soldiers, really? I jokingly said two during that scene and wasn't too far off --and underestimate their enemies to their everlasting sorrow. I really do want them to win -- retake Winterfell, rescue their brother and all that -- and reunite, but they simply have to accept the world for what it is and not for what they want it to be.

Does anyone know who the particular "Brothers Without Banners" were?  The kind of looked like the guys who were with Locke when the captured Jaime & Brienne - was it Rorge & Biter?  Which would basically make them outlaws posing as the brotherhood because isn't the brotherhood supposed to protect small folk?  Or maybe they've just become red God fanatics at this point.

In the books, Jaime's story is a bit different, and he becomes quite a bit more sympathetic.  There are fewer scenes fornicating with Cersei beside the coffins of their dead children (major creep factor)...

I have to give the show credit for the way in which it manages to turn characters that seemed irredeemable at one point into sympathetic figures, and make it believable. First it was Jamie after losing his hand, then Theon after becoming Reek, and even Cersei after the humiliating walk of atonement. Now they seem to have done it with the Hound. It's rather skillful storytelling.

Arya's situation just got a whole lot more interesting. I was thinking that she would be able to hold her own with the Waif and maybe even kill her. I didn't understand why she was behaving so casually given that she had defied her orders to kill the actress.

I am looking forward to seeing Brienne and Jamie meet up again. I thought this Riverrun storyline was one that had been sacrificed for the sake of time. Also surprised to see the Brotherhood without Banners again. That may hint at the return of another abandoned storyline that fans have been asking for.
Maybe Sansa's changed her mind about Littlefinger and trying to contact him?

I also thought it was one of the dullest episodes ever. The Margery/Olenna/Sparrow subplot was so plodding for what it achieved; they could have wrapped up that little bit of plot advancement in less than half the time. Sansa and Jon going door-to-door looking for armies was oddly absurd, although it did provide the episodes's one highlight--little Lady Lyanna. The Hound's return has potential but seeing Ian McShane's character gone as quickly as he arrived was depressing even for a show with so much death. The episode even ended early. There better be some mighty big payoff before season's end.

Who's to say that McShane isn't coming back? Just because he's hanged? Ha!

In a show where Jon Snow comes back from the dead, The Hound comes back from certain death (with McShane's assistance), The Mountain comes back from the near-death, and the Men without Hats or Banner's champion comes back from the dead--and Dany survives death by fire twice, there's no reason that McShane's character can't come back from the dead, particularly when you consider his most resonant line from the episode: “It's never too late to come back.”
I'm not saying that he's coming back, I'm only saying that we don't know that he's not. There may be a rope-a-dope strategy.

Maybe they hired Ian McShane for exactly the reason that we*would* expect him to be around for a while.

And/or -- who wouldn't hire him, given the opportunity to hang out between takes? ;-)

Save for a few scattered interesting moments, an inexcusably dull episode. But that's hardly the worst offense. You certainly don't hire a terrific actor like Ian McShane just to hang him at the end of the episode. That was colossally idiotic. This one get my vote for the worst episode of the season. I mean, what? Did the producers collectively skip town while this episode filmed?
Martin, that -- PM (post meridiem) -- is an argument for why it is not redundant.

I smiled when I read your paring not of wine and food, but wine and music.  Brilliant!  I too have favorite music to play when I drink Provençal rosés: the soundtrack to the Richard Linklater movie Before Midnight.  The movie is set in the Peloponnese, by the way, so geographically much closer to Provence than where I live now (Great Lakes area).

Good Evening: Back in my wine industry days, the rule for Rose wine and food pairings went as follows--pink on pink. This week marks the 13th anniversary of when I wiped out my credit card debt forever. To celebrate, the Commanderie de Peyrassol 2015 with a platter of prosciutto, porchetta, smoked salmon, strawberries, raspberries, cherry tomatoes with olive oil and Zatar, and a wedge of St. Andre cheese with crackers. The music? A Geneva jazz harmonica player named Gregoire Maret and his self-titled 2012 CD. The food pairings succeeded: best with the fruit and cheese; very good with the smoked salmon and pork; satisfactory with the cherry tomatoes.

As for the wine itself, I would describe the color as a very pale salmon-pink. The nose: cherry, raspberry, strawberry, floral, and a real surprise--mineral, like the Austrian Rieslings of a few months ago. The taste: same as the nose, plus what I can only describe as pomegranate. Most interesting: the crisp, high acid body and the mineral character, which really helps the wine stand up to, and augment, the cheese, salmon and meats. Would probably work with a baked or grilled whole fish.

In honor of my 13th anniversary, I improvised a cocktail. Muddle two sliced strawberries and 8 raspberries in the bottom of a pint glass. Add 6 ounces of the Peyrassol or other Rose. Fill with seltzer, stir gently to float the fruit, add a few ice cubes. Garnish with a sprig of mint.

I call it the Freedom Pink.

I am betting Dany lands in Dorne.  There is the historical precedent, the ancient queen Nymeria landed in Dorne with one thousand ships, then burnt them all, saying their wandering was at an end...things tend to happen and then happen again in that universe, so I am betting its Dorne (helloooo, sand fleas).

I think Jaime owes Grumpy Bronn (can't blame him) a long shore leave in the nearest brothel. If the Hound can get his ale, why not? What the hell was Arya thinking strolling along in broad daylight? Love that she lost the House of B/W hairstyle. I think she will be helped by the mummers but would certainly welcome a surprise appearance from her old "dancing" master. We never saw him die, let alone get stabbed, right?
Sansa's letter is for Littlefinger, hence the reluctant look she had. Perhaps the Vale's army will be joined along the way by the Blackfish's. Which might free Jaime up to go back to Kings Landing, though maybe some battle action might knock him back to reality (i.e. give up on his love affair with his sister). Three more to – can't wait for the big battle in the 9th or 10th. I think the last scene will be the Greyjoys meeting Dany.
Yes, although let's hope Bear Island has some strong defenses, because if she is sending away all 62 fighters, it might appear a tempting target for House Bolton.
She is with the army at its encampment. The was a shot at the end of that scene where Davos and Jon looked over at her.
and Donald Trump

Let's see:
✓ Immune to blarney
✓ Listens/seeks answers from learned advisors
✓ Forms her own opinion
✓ Willing to change mind when warranted
✓ Willing to risk everything for the right cause
✓ Stands up for her followers ("62 Bear Islanders > 620 Mainlanders")
✓ Goes into battle along with men she committed to the cause

At 10 Lyanna Mormont is already a better leader than than any of the young Starks, Lannisters, or Targaryens who think they're entitled to rule the Seven Kingdoms.
I have a feeling that he's going to use that axe to acquire another sword and a nicer set of armor.
So happy to have The Hound back. I wonder if he remembers where he left that armor and sword?
No, Davos did not learned of Shereen's fate. He asked the red woman, who refused to reply.

The High Sparrow gave Margery an ultimatum - either tell your grandma to go home or we will lock her up too.  Whether or not he know she is not a true believer doesn't really matter to him - yet.  He knows she got the message and will send Oleanna away
this inevitable matchup is called 'Clegane-bowl' in the GOT chatterboards...word is that it might happen, but not til next season...

I am wondering, in light of the HS approaching Margaery and suggesting she have sex with Tommen-- there was major creep factor there.  He is going to do or suggest something sexually inappropriate (that was his favorite vice, if I am remembering his backstory correctly) and discredit himself, losing the whip hand he now has...

The whole Oleana things smells of a setup by the Pryce character. He knows she is a formidable foe and wants her away, while also breaking up the joint force of Lannister and Tyrell. So he got Margaery to get Oleana out of the way, knowing that nobody else would be able to do it. That means he is wise to what Margeary's act, and is using her instead of the other way round.

Butch something is wrong with the amount you are giving for your taxes. I live in  Sandy Springs, Fulton County.  There is no way that you are only paying $500 in taxes on a house the tax accesser has appraised at $250,000. You would have a .83% tax rate, I just looked it up. The average house is $258K and pays $2150 in property taxes ( approx.) . You must be over 65 and have the exemption from School taxes. Then you must also have a disability exemption, or a disabled veterans exemption on your county tax portion.  If not the tax man will soon find out that your property is not correctly appraised, because you should be paying an amount equal to .83% the value to live way outside the city.  As growth continues and the need for infrastructure increases in proportion. Larger courthouse, jail, more administration, more police, fire, more roads, more schools, etc... they will raise the taxes. Ask those in Cobb, Gwinnett, what has happened to them. The same folks keep moving out for the cheaper housing.

Ms Powers wasn't wrong about Obama and his views of success (tax it heavily), failure (cushion it with other people's money), achievement (negate it by "leveling the playing field), business ("You didn't build that") or the value of labor ("No one working full time should live in poverty).
Really? What country are you living in? Real estate values the highest they have ever been? Please quit believing the lying liberal media because that is no where near the truth!

I loved Tracey Ponsoldt Powers' (Code name "Daughter" LOL) rant against the election of President Barack Obama for fear that he was a "socialist." SO predictable, and SO WRONG, but should I or anyone be surprised?

I wonder whether after 8 years of a US stock market climb, real estate values at the highest levels they've ever been, and corporations rolling in dollars she's still so grotesquely clueless and un-self-aware, or if she's woken up?

At least one headline in today's Times belies her claims about China; its debt is so unsustainable it is teetering on the brink! Additionally her comments about the gold standard were laughably absurd.

All these shenanigans involving Mossack Fonseca were not, though. Once again they show that people with money and power game the system, and all the rest of us have to pay the price.

If I were a betting person, I would put my money on on whom she'll be voting for this fall, if she votes. His last name is T-R-U-M-P.
Clint, right! Why won't she have her sword? And where did she get all that money?
there is a theory that we didnt see Arya at all in episode 7...but then, there are many theories about that scene.  I guess we will all find out next sunday (or not, who knows?).

If it was Arya, she didn't have Needle, and she had at least two large bags of coins hidden on her body well enough that I couldn't see any bulges when she was on the bridge-- and I looked during several viewings of the scene.

So what if she had a coin belt of some kind on, and had a wine bladder full of animal guts and blood in front of that, as well as perhaps some chain mail of some kind behind the coin belt, she could have faked the severity of her injuries at least, in order to fake her death, cheat the Many Faced God and the Faceless Men, and escape to a carefree life of assassination and vengeance in the West.

However at this point I'm leaning towards some other explanation popular on the internet right now concerning a different dynamic at work between the Waif and Jaqen H'ghar, and that Arya is, in fact, still well-hidden in her dark underground grotto, clutching Needle, waiting for a time she feels she can make her escape from Braavos.

I didn't get Arya. Last we left her, she was in the dark waiting for the Waif. She didn't even look like herself this week. I almost half-expected her to be someone else. I had this wild idea that the Waif was going to do something horrible in her body and get her killed. It didn't make sense when I thought of it, but I just couldn't reconcile this scene with last week.

Also, the whole scene with the Hound and his marry bend of pacifists was pretty comical in some ways. It was pretty heavy-handed and you knew immediately what was going to happen to all of them. I think if the showrunners let the scene breathe, it would have been more impactful. As it was, it was almost too fast for emotional impact.
